title: Ukranian Man Chops Off Rapist's Penis With Swiss Army Knife, Faces Longer Jail Term Than Rapist
text:
In a fit of rage, a man from Ukraine chopped off a rapist's penis after he caught him sexually assaulting his wife.

According to reports, the 27-year-old husband, was heading home after attending a party at a restaurant in their village of Shevchenkovo, in the Ukraine’s eastern Kharkiv region.

Picture for representation

His wife had left the restaurant just 10 minutes before, in the wee hours. But just as she was nearing her apartment building, she was allegedly attacked from behind by 25-year-old Dmitry Ivchenko.

When the victim's husband reached the apartment block, he heard noises coming from the bushes and he claimed to see Ivchenko strangling his wife while raping her.

Furious after what he saw, the man first punched the rapist and went on to chop his penis off with a Swiss Army knife. Many of those in the area rushed to the scene, awoken by the alleged rapist’s screams of pain and the victim’s crying.

The man's anger was understandable, but despite that he faces a longer sentence than the rapist himself.

Furious husband chops off rapist’s penis after catching him attacking his wife in the street https://t.co/sZuUwdh2yS — The Irish Sun (@IrishSunOnline) October 17, 2019

He has been charged with causing grievous bodily harm and has been placed under house arrest. He has since told local media, ‘I cannot explain what happened to me at that moment.’

After the attack, the rapist was rushed to the hospital for treatment, while surgeons were able to reattach the severed penis but are not sure about it's functionality.

Picture For Representation

Officers have launched a criminal case for rape against Ivchenko, who remains in hospital under police surveillance.

If found guilty, the husband could face up to eight years in prison, while Ivchenko could face up to five years, which is unfair, but that's what the law lays down.
